abstract.p: Britain's Laura Ashley Holdings PLC returns to first-half profit after years of losss that brought company to brink of insolvency; first-half net income rose to 1.1 million pounds, or $1.54 million, compared with loss of 7.2 million pounds year earlier (S)

block.p: After years of losses that brought it to the brink of insolvency, Laura Ashley Holdings P.L.C., the British chain best known for floral prints, said it returned to a first-half profit following a shift toward home furnishings. The company, which sold off its money-losing business in the United States last year, said first-half net income rose to $:1.1 million or $1.54 million, compared with a loss of $:7.2 million one year earlier. Home furnishings accounted for 60 percent of its $:118 million sales.
